"... So, now, I don't have my faith I think,
because, true, we are really in freedom,
but, if God wants, it may be,
The particle ma' is the common form of negation in Yucatec Maya. It can either be used with a
verb or a lexical phrase, or alone (just to say "no"). Ma' usually precedes modal or aspectual prefixes; but
some aspectual prefixes (like k-) cannot appear with it, and in this case ma' directly precedes the ergative
For the completive "never" (something that has never happened, but not that will never happen),
the form mix jun tèen/ mix jum p'ùul ("nor one time") is used.
28 / Institut für Ethnologie der Universität Bern: Arbeitsblätter Nr. 14, 1996
I say that there won't be any revolt soon,

but we don't know really in what time".[TI.1]

tier.item: b. Áalkab-il h úuch u bin.
Alternatively, the verb p'áat `leave', `abandon' might be used instead of bin. The source of p'áat
can be specified by an adjunct, but p'áat is far less frequent in narratives. Notice, though, that (28) is a
constructed example and that I'm not entirely sure how native speaker would translate (27) out of
`In a running manner he left, i.e. he rán away.'
